name: Gun Metal
description: Gun Metal is a futuristic action-packed experience where you take control of the fully transformable prototype combat vehicle known as the Havoc Suit.The Havoc Suit, a prototype combat vehicle, remains the only hope to save civilization from a tireless enemy.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 98 / 2000 / XP / Vista / 7 Processor: 900 MHz Intel Memory: 256 MB RAM Graphics: 64 MB DirectX: Version 8.0 Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: i missed this game so much. I'm glad they put it on steam.

A short but sweet action game. I recomend it to anyone wh like blasting through a hordes with a variety of interesting weapons. It's only about 4-6 hourse if you decide to blaze right through it. For it's length it's pretty pricey at 10 $ but If you manage to get it on sale it'll be worth your time to grab it. Way back in the day I got this together with Battle Engine Aquila bundled with a graphics card of all things and spent a good few days playing and replaying it.

Pros: - Amazing, fast-paced gameplay - Variety of single player missions - Two ways to play, either on the ground or in the air - Good graphics, soundtracks and sound effects (note the release year 2003)  Cons: - Camera is sometimes in very awful angles from which you can't see anything - Buggy on today's systems, sometimes after a mission all the texts are almost like from matrix. Although a simple restart of the game is the fix for this :)

I mean, it's like toned down Gundam with a really arcade gameplay. It's very fun an engaging but not deep. Just fly and shoot stuff. I enjoyed it tho. It had been in my backlog for quite a while tho.  The only problem this game had is the mouse control. Flying using the mouse is hard as you will occasionally damage yourself by bumping on building a lot after you transform in a city before you got the hang of the flight.  Since the game isn't really deep and it is fairly short. So do the review for it.  Buy this during sale tho.  7/10

That's an example of game that aged well. It's still very playable (I never played it before) and graphics are not painful for eye. It feels good enough for a price on a sale, althoguh many people could obtain it for free.
TPS fromm back in the day. its pretty good. pretty damn dated now.

If you don't have time for Mechwarrior, then give this a game a try. It's a quick mech fix arcade style, but think arcade done very well. I had to reduce mouse sensitivity. This reminds us that games are supposed to be fun...like a roller coaster.
brings back memories <3 still a good game!

Still fun as hell these 10 years later. Transorm from mech to jet and back again whilst shooting enemies. Can be beaten in around 3 hours but is a blast to play through again with all the weapons unlocked. No additional gamemodes aside from the main missions but each offer a decent variety of objectives.   tl;dr this game is fun

This is like transformers: you can switch between standard robotic mech and flying mech (more like a fighter jet). But awkward mouse control makes this old game mostly unplayable on a PC, even after setting it to run in Win XP, SP3 compat mode. Cannot move and aim precisely, as it feels like you're constantly panning in one direction or another. And there is too much glare when trying to move or aim toward the sun. But, on other platforms maybe it works ok.   Music's not too bad, tho...  (Note: Acquired via a bundle)
The game is fun but it seems like the port was ♥♥♥♥ing up the controlls.

Surprisingly fun arcade game, where you can switch between a mech and a fighter aircraft. The graphics are simple, so is the gameplay, yet it's more fun than some of those AAA titles in the market. Give it a try.
nice game. Has the best gameplay in 2015
This is one of those games that your friend dares you to buy, so you do to spite him, but end up regretting the purchase and eventually uninstalling it after the second mission.  10/10
Danker than my memes

It was okay then on like the third mission the escort mission it is impossible to get all four convoys there so you end up only saving two then you fly to a big battle and get your ♥♥♥ handed to you and there are no checkpoints so you get to redo a very long mission. That alone, no checkpoints, made me uninstall and begin the process of forgetting I wasted any time on this.  Even if the game had checkpoints, the controls are still garbage and there are two horrible problems. The first is that a lot of times you have to be going in the direction of the sun because enemies are right directly in front of it so you have to stare into a god damn supernova sun while you fight and it will burn your ♥♥♥♥ing eyes out. I had to play with my eyes nearly closed half the time. That and your crosshair is barely noticable during heavy action which is always. I CONSTANTLY in all the action and confusion lost my crosshair so most of the time I had no idea where I was shooting. Another problem is that the big ships shoot a constant stream of green lasers that are not dodge-able no matter where you are, and you have to be within range to shoot them so it makes no sense and you get ripped apart fast.  NOT a old classic at all, just a old pain. But hey it got 75% positive reviews so it has to be good right? I just need to get good right?
Gun Metal is a game that I recommend because: - is a method to banish boredom - is a shooter - have trading cards - have action - have third-person  Enjoy!
Horrible sh!t.

I am about to review a game based on 20 mins of gameplay. I have always been a firm believer that a game has to grab you within the first few minutes of gameplay to come to conclusion if you will continue playing. Same with girls choosing within 5 minutes if they will sleep with you. This game brings forth great awesomeness. It brings me back to the old school Afterburner Arcady games mixed in with over the top MECH Warrior action. The graphics are a bit meh, but it pays homage to so many games. I actually enjoy the fact that the developers paid more attention to gameplay than graphics. Love this game, the controllers are amazing, honestly better than most Triple A titles. The action is intest as well. Sorry this review is all over the place, I am far too excited for this game. Buy this game, do not hesitate, stop reading this crappy review and BUY THIS GAME. DillengerX Out!
Nice FPS game?!

If you are looking for a simple, fast and enjoyable gameplay, then I definitely recommend this game. The graphics are decent, sound is good, you have plenty of weapons to choose. Hell, even story is not that bad (although you have to read the manual to know what's going on).  The downside is, that it ends too quickly. And that price. For 13-year old game.

Years ago this game was a graphic benchmark. Surprisingly, graphics have not aged that much and game still looks nice. Needs some tweaking for widescreen.  cons: - very short and no replay value, 2.5 horus and game is 100% mastered. Spent $1 and happy with it, but would be really disappointed if I paid full price
Decent game for what it is. Fairly good graphics, but the sun can be quite overwhelming at times. Definitely has some bugs that need to be worked out, but all-in-all a good game.
A very nice game. its fun, not long, if you think 4-5 hours is worth the price get it just remember one thing go to advanced options and turn off the sun its your worst enemy in the game.

If you don't mind playing a transformers kind of game from 2000, then this is the game for you. On sale, at least.   I like the game (bugs put aside) as it have it's own charm, so to speak, but I won't be playing this for days... Nice if you have a slow internet connection, the download isn't big.
It might be old, but the gameplay is awesome! for the time it got released it was such a inovation, I have played and replayed it many times... the nostalgy :D
